cleaned_text: Do you suffer from allergies? If so, you're not alone. According to the [Asthma and Allergy Foundation of America](https://www.aafa.org/), about 50 million Americans suffer from allergies each year which shows us the epidemiology of Dermatophagoides Farinae Allergy in the USA. Dermatophagoides farinae allergy is a type of [dust allergy](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/allergies-a-to-z/dust-allergy/), which is caused by exposure to [dust mites](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House_dust_mite). Dust mites are tiny creatures that live in dust and are too small to see with the naked eye. If you suffer from dermatophagoides farinae allergy, you may experience symptoms such as sneezing, coughing, and itchy, watery eyes. As per Ayurveda, several herbs can help to relieve the symptoms of dermatophagoides farinae allergy. In this article, we'll take a look at the top 10 effective Herbs that are very useful in the [natural treatment of Dermatophagoides Farinae Allergy](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/blog/treatment-of-dermatophagoides-farinae-allergy/). (Oxalis corniculata)](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/herbs-a-to-z/changeri-oxalis-corniculata/) Changeri is one of the most ancient and commonly used herbs for the treatment of various allergic conditions. The Vata and Kapha pacifying actions of chargeri make it more suitable to manage allergic conditions. It has antimicrobial, anti-inflammatory, and antibacterial actions. Its antioxidative action boosts immunity to fight against flu symptoms of dust farinae allergy. Phytoconstituents like Vitamin A, B, C, D, E, K, and flavonoids help to reduce the symptoms of sneezing, rashes, and inflammation of the skin. 2. [Yashtimadhu (Glycyrrhiza glabra)](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/herbs-a-to-z/yastimadhu-glycyrrhiza-glabra/) Due to its sweet taste and cold pacifying action, it is a Vata and Pitta pacifier. It manages chronic cough, breathing difficulties, headache, and frequent sneezing. It has antimicrobial, antiviral, and anti-inflammatory properties making it more suitable for the treatment of various allergies. Any rashes due to farinae dust allergy can be easily cured by applying the paste of yashtimadhu due to its cold potency. It is one of the most commonly used Herbs for Dermatophagoides Farinae Allergy. Although, it is contraindicated in pregnant, nursing women, and hypertensive patients. 3. [Tulsi (Ocimum tenuiflorum)](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/herbs-a-to-z/tulasi-ocimum-sanctum/) Tulsi (Holy Basil) is an effective natural remedy for dermatophagoides farinae allergy. It helps to relieve itching, inflammation, and the severity of symptoms. In addition to reducing itching, it also reduces redness or swelling caused by [eczema](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/blog/treat-eczema-through-ayurveda/). The herb can help you have fewer attacks if taken regularly before an attack starts and if taken during an attack itself. Basil has been shown in studies to reduce itching by up to 50% compared with no treatment at all! This makes basil one of our top choices for treating Dermatophagoides farinae allergies. 4. [Chamomile (Matricaria chamomilla)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Matricaria_chamomilla) Chamomile tea is an effective way to soothe chafed, irritated skin. It has anti-inflammatory properties that can help relieve itchiness and redness associated with dermatophagoides farinae allergy. You can also use chamomile to treat other types of dermatitis like poison ivy or bug bites. It is the most preferred herb of the Top 10 Herbs for Dermatophagoides farinae Allergy. Chamomile contains compounds called flavonoids, which are responsible for its medicinal benefits such as fighting infections. The main component in this herb is apigenin which possesses antioxidant properties that may protect against skin damage caused by UV exposure or sunburns. It also has anti-inflammatory properties which can help soothe itchy skin due to dermatophagoides farinae allergy symptoms including eczema flare-ups. 5. [Ela (Elettaria cardamomum)](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/dravya-herbs-part-a/ela-dwaya-elettaria-cardamomom-maton-amomum-subulatum-roxb/) It is an effective antiseptic, and stimulant which is used in the treatment of sore throat and prolonged cough. Ela contains many derived plant alkaloids which are antioxidants useful in fighting flu-like symptoms. To get instant relief from the cough of marinade dust allergy, mix a pinch of Ela powder with a pinch of salt and raw honey. Have this early in the morning to get good results. Ela along with cloves helps in relieving irritation in the throat which is caused due to [dust mite allergy](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/blog/get-rid-of-dust-mite-allergy-fast/). 6. [Bhumi Amla (Phyllanthus niruri)](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/herbs-a-to-z/bhumi-amla-phyllanthus-niruri/) Among the Top 10 Herbs for Dermatophagoides farinae Allergy, one cannot miss this precious herb. Due to its Kapha and Pitta balancing properties, it is used to treat various allergies, colds, and coughs caused due to farinae dust allergy. It is the prime herb used in the preparation of different types of anti-allergic preparations. Fresh juice of the whole plant is used as a nasal drop for [treating nasal allergies](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/blog/treatment-of-nasal-allergies-in-children/). It has anti-allergic, antiviral, and antifungal properties which are highly recommended in treating farinae dust allergies. Its blood-purifying properties help in reducing skin issues and inflammation caused due to farinae dust allergy. 7. [Dalchini (Cinnamomum verum)](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/herbs-a-to-z/tvak-cinnamomum-zeylanicum/) Dalchini is known as Tvak in Sanskrit. Due to its antiviral, anti-inflammatory, and antimicrobial, it is widely used in the treatment of symptoms of farinae dust allergy. It also has good amounts of antioxidants like flavonoids, and alkaloids which are useful in resisting infections and boosting immunity. Tvak powder mixed with Ela powder with honey and ghee is proven to give instant relief in cough. Daily consumption of dalchini has also proven to enhance immunity and keep you away from frequent flu infections. 8. [Shirish (Albizia lebbeck)](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/herbs-a-to-z/shirish-albizia-lebbeck/) Shirish is one of the most recommended Herbs for Dermatophagoides Farinae Allergy. Phytoconstituents present in Shirish help to suppress the histamine receptors thereby limiting allergic reactions. It is also widely known for its usage in the [treatment of skin allergies](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/allergies-a-to-z/skin-allergy/) and [nasal allergies](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/allergies-a-to-z/nasal-allergy/). If you are getting rashes due to farinae allergy, then apply the paste of Shirish's bark or leaf to get instant relief from itching and burning sensation. 9. [Rosemary (Salvia rosmarinus)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rosemary) Rosemary is an herb that can be used to treat dermatophagoides farinae allergy. Rosemary has fragrant leaves and flowers, which give off an aroma similar to peppermint or spearmint. In addition to treating dermatophagoides farinae allergy symptoms like red itchy skin and swollen eyes, rosemary has been shown to reduce inflammation in the body by inhibiting certain enzymes involved in causing pain when exposed to allergens. 10. [Hingu (Ferula assa-foetida)](https://www.iafaforallergy.com/herbs-a-to-z/hingu-ferula-foetida/) IAFA had done some studies on herbs including Hingu, commonly known as Asafoetida to know its significance among the Top 10 Herbs for Dermatophagoides farinae Allergy and found out that it has anti-allergic and antioxidant properties which are highly essential in treating allergies. IAFA has further tested that Hingu powder can be extensively used in allergic conditions. The gummy exudate of Hingu is heated and powdered and is used to treat frequent and prolonged coughs. It is also recommended to boost immunity thereby reducing the frequency of infections.
